snippet.title: Police release images of man fleeing Wollongong business fire
snippet.content:
Police release images of man fleeing Wollongong business fire
CCTV images released by police as part of an investigation into a fire at a Wollongong business last year.
CCTV images released by police as part of an investigation into a fire at a Wollongong business last year.
CCTV images released by police as part of an investigation into a fire at a Wollongong business last year.
exit Police have released images of man who reportedly ran from the scene of a fire that ripped through a Wollongong business.
The fire - just after 4am on July 18, 2016 - significantly damaged the Kenny Street business and is being treated as suspicious. Five people were inside at the time of the blaze, but did not require medical treatment. Investigators have been told a man was seen fleeing south on Kenny Street and have released CCTV images of a person they say could assist with inquiries. The man seen the images is wearing light-coloured pants, a black hooded jumper and white sneakers. Anyone with information should contact Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000.
